original: The radicalism of the early Modernists in Brazil was not sustainable within a society accustomed to traditional artistic conventions. By 1929, the original core members of this movement had diverged, each pursuing their individual artistic paths. Consequently, Brazilian art evolved into a blend of significant achievements from the Modernists, characterized by a departure from strict academic norms, alongside more conventional elements.
